author: Staff Reporter
text:
Film director Cheran’s daughter appeared before the Judicial Magistrate’s Court here on Tuesday in connection with a cheque bounce case.

The case pertained to the C2H venture floated by the director in 2012.

According to sources, after the project failed to take off, the plaintiff, Prasanna of Dharmapuri, who had paid the dealership deposit for the Cinema 2 Home venture, demanded the money back.

Nivedha Priyadarshini (25), who was the managing director of C2H firm, had issued a cheque for Rs. 4.50 lakh to Prasanna. But, the cheque had bounced and allegedly no efforts were made to honour the payment.

The first hearing commenced at the court of JM II.
title: Hearing begins in cheque bounce case
